result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: While incarcerated inmate funds shall be applied to outstanding financial obligations per DOC policy.

superMiscConds.notes: AODA evaluation and comply with recommendations.

Counseling deemed necessary, which may include Thinking for a Change.

Absolute sobriety.

Take medication as prescribed.

DNA sample must be provided within 30 days.

supervisions.notes:
If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Consecutive to: 22CF161 and concurrent to 22CF15

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A Schultz

No contact with victim or residence, except at the visitation booth at the Wood County Jail.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription. Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol.  Reside in the State of Wisconsin.

8:17 AM Defendant Mark A Schultz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gavin Grubofski in court for Mark A Schultz.  Attorney Austin M Mogard in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Grubofski has filed a motion to modify bond conditions to allow contact with K.O. only at the jail visitation booth at the Wood County Jail.
K.O. makes statement. Attorney Mogard does not oppose motion to modify bond conditions.
Court modifies bond to allow contact with K.O. at the jail visitation booth at the Wood County Jail.
Motion to Modify Bond
Motion hearing on July 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark A Schultz in court, in custody.  Attorney Gavin Grubofski in court for Mark A Schultz. 
Court orders Pre-Sentence Investigation. Victim is requesting that bond be modified to allow contact. State is opposed. Court denies request to modify bond.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Statement of Read-Ins
Final pre-trial on June 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Craig Lambert appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Mark A Schultz appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Gavin Grubofski for Mark A Schultz appeared in court. 
Terry Johnson is sworn as a witness and questioned by Attorney Lambert. He is a deputy with the Wood County Sheriff's Department. On 3/7/22, he was dispatched to a residence in the Village of Port Edwards regarding a disturbance. KLO ndicated that defendant had threatened to kill her and and she feared for her safety. Later that night defendant tried to strangle her with a cord and she lost consciousness. She stated that she could not breathe. She was able to escape and run to a neighbor's residence. He testifies as to visible injuries. She recorded the audio of the incident on her phone. The witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom.
Attorney Grubofski cross-examines witness.  
Attorney Lambert asks Court take judicial notice of Wood County case 22CF15, a case the defendant was out on bond for.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the defendant committed it. Not guilty plea to all counts. Bond is continued.
Status conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Absolute sobriety. WOSO 22-4114 $2000

No contact with victim or their residence, No controlled substances without a valid prescription. Absolute sobriety. Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is to sell or serve alcohol. Reside in the State of Wisconsin. $500,000
